label: TaskLifecycle
description: Lifecycle of an individual Task from creation through updates, completion state changes, and eventual deletion.
justification: The specification emphasizes basic task management: creating tasks, editing them, marking them complete or incomplete, and deleting them as part of the core task lifecycle.

label: CategoryLifecycle
description: Lifecycle of a Category including its creation, renaming, and deletion.
justification: The spec describes categories (simple lists) that can be created, renamed, and deleted, forming a clear lifecycle for category management.

label: TaskOrganizationFlow
description: Grouping of concepts involved in organizing tasks into categories, managing category lifecycles, and viewing tasks by category.
justification: Organization into simple lists or categories and filtering by category are described as core capabilities, along with creating, renaming, and deleting these categories.

label: MainListViewFlow
description: End-to-end flow for presenting and interacting with the main task list view: show tasks, then allow filtering and sorting by various criteria.
justification: The main list view is a core capability where all tasks are shown and the user can filter by completion status and category and sort by creation time, due date, or title.

label: ViewPreferencePersistenceFlow
description: Flow for configuring and persisting filter and sort preferences that define the userâ€™s default view when opening the app.
justification: The spec requires remembering filter and sorting preferences so the app opens in a useful default view, implying configuration and persistence of these settings.

label: PersistenceAndAutosaveService
description: Service-level grouping that covers automatic saving of tasks and view preferences into the local task store with no explicit Save button.
justification: The app is local-first, must persist tasks and preferences between sessions, and must autosave changes without an explicit Save button, suggesting a persistence service centered on the LocalTaskStore.

label: CoreTaskAndViewDataModel
description: Core data model for the single-user app including tasks, categories, the main task list view, filter/sort settings, default view configuration, and the local task store.
justification: These entities constitute the essential state the app manages to support the described core capabilities around tasks, categories, viewing, and persistence.

label: FutureTaskPriorityFeatureSet
description: Future feature set enabling simple task priority levels with corresponding visual cues.
justification: Task priorities and visual cues are described as a nice-to-have feature, separate from the core capabilities.

label: FutureRemindersAndRecurrenceFeatureSet
description: Future capabilities for configuring local reminders and notifications as well as defining and applying recurrence patterns for tasks.
justification: Reminders/notifications and recurring tasks are future capabilities that both extend how tasks behave over time and interact with due dates.

label: FutureRicherOrganizationAndSearch
description: Future feature family providing richer organization via tags and saved views, plus free-text search across tasks with optional filters.
justification: Richer organization (tags, saved views) and search are forward-looking enhancements that build on the core view and organization model.

label: FutureExportImportFeatureSet
description: Backup and portability feature set for exporting tasks to a simple file format and importing them back.
justification: Data export and import are called out as a nice-to-have for backup and moving tasks between machines.

label: FutureAnalyticsAndSuggestionsFeatureSet
description: Feature set for computing analytics summaries, visualizing simple charts, and generating smart suggestions about which tasks to do next.
justification: Analytics/insights and smart suggestions are closely related analytical capabilities and can be developed as one coherent future package with a suggestion engine.

label: FutureSyncFeatureSet
description: Optional, opt-in multi-device synchronization feature set controlled by sync configuration and handled by a sync engine.
justification: Multi-device sync is explicitly framed as an optional, privacy-preserving capability requiring configuration and an active synchronization mechanism.

label: FutureThemingAndCustomizationFeatureSet
description: Theming and layout customization feature set covering theme settings, layout configuration, and actions to select themes, customize colors, and adjust the main view layout.
justification: Theming and customization, including light/dark mode, custom colors, and user-defined main view layouts, are grouped as UI-oriented future enhancements.

label: CoreSingleUserLocalApp
description: High-level aggregate of the core single-user, local, browser-based to-do list application: main actors, core data entities, and essential actions (task and category management, main view usage, preferences, autosave, and offline operation).
justification: The requirements emphasize a simple, single-user, offline-capable local app with no accounts, focusing on core task, category, view, and persistence behavior; this aggregation captures that core scope.
